name: Kurt
description: A traditional Kazakh snack made from dried cheese curd, formed into balls and left to harden, noted for its salty and sour taste. It's a popular snack among nomadic cultures due to its long shelf life.
steps: Drain the whey from sour milk or yogurt completely.
Mix the curd with salt and press any remaining liquid out.
Form the curd into small balls and cover them in cloth.
Leave the balls to dry in a cool, ventilated area until hard.
Store in a dry place until ready to consume.
tips: The longer the kurt dries, the harder and more flavorful it becomes.
Kurt is very versatile and can be used in soups or eaten as a snack.
If the climate is humid, kurt may need to be dried indoors in a well-ventilated area.
